jx.jx_en_mean: To pursue relentlessly so as to overcome or destroy.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 追逐，搜捕：全力追逐以便征服或毁灭

jx.jx_en_mean: To go after in earnest; set out to obtain
jx.jx_cn_mean: 竭力谋求：热切地追求；着手去获得
(非正式)（重要的或有权力的）大人物

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)act before the proper or appropriate time
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)在正常（或适当）的时间之前行动，过早行动

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)refuse to compromise or change, despite criticism
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)拒绝妥协；坚持自己的立场

lj.lj_ly: we have stuck to our guns on that issue.
lj.lj_ls: 在那个问题上我们坚持了自己的立场。

lj.lj_ly: the top guns in contention for the coveted post of chairman.
lj.lj_ls: 争夺为众人觊觎的主席之位的大佬们。

jx.jx_en_mean: To proceed or perform with great speed, skill, or success.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 全速进行，大获成功：以很快的速度、高超的技巧或巨大的成功从事或完成

jx.jx_en_mean: Under great pressure or under threat.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 处于巨大的压力或威胁之下

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English gunne, gonne, perhaps from a pet form of the Scandinavian name Gunnhildr, from gunnr + hildr, both meaning 'war'

entry.def: A gun is a weapon from which bullets or other things are fired.

example.ex: He produced a gun and he came into the house...
The inner-city has guns and crime and drugs and deprivation.
example.tran: 市中心的贫民区充斥着滥用枪支、犯罪、吸毒和贫困问题。

entry.def: A gun or a starting gun is an object like a gun that is used to make a noise to signal the start of a race.

example.ex: The starting gun blasted and they were off.
example.tran: 发令枪响了，他们冲了出去。

entry.tran: 把…发动起来；给…加大油门；使加速
entry.def: To gun an engine or a vehicle means to make it start or go faster by pressing on the accelerator pedal.

example.ex: He gunned his engine and drove off.

entry.def: If you come out with guns blazing or with all guns blazing, you put all your effort and energy into trying to achieve something.

example.ex: The company came out with guns blazing.
example.tran: 公司鼓足了劲要大干一番。

entry.def: If you jump the gun, you do something before everyone else or before the proper or right time.

example.ex: It wasn't due to be released until September 10, but some booksellers have jumped the gun and decided to sell it early.
example.tran: 这本书定于9月10号发行，但是一些书商已抢先一步，决定提前销售。

entry.tran: 坚持自己的立场；固执己见；一意孤行
entry.def: If you stick to your guns, you continue to have your own opinion about something even though other people are trying to tell you that you are wrong.

example.ex: He should have stuck to his guns and refused to meet her.
example.tran: 他本应坚持己见，拒绝与她会面。

means.word_mean: 1. a weapon that discharges a missile at high velocity (especially from a metal tube or barrel)
3. a person who shoots a gun (as regards their ability)
4. a professional killer who uses a gun
5. a hand-operated pump that resembles a gun; forces grease into parts of a machine
6. a pedal that controls the throttle valve;
7. the discharge of a gun as signal or as a salute in military ceremonies;

example.en: l knew they would bring in the big guns at the last minute.
example.zh: 我早就知道在最后时刻他们会把那些大人物搬出来的。

example.en: Against these big critics' big guns. I offer Serban & Co. some shelter.
example.zh: 我为塞班公司捉供挡箭牌来对付那些大批评家的抨击。

Sentence.sentence: A medium-sized young man carrying a gun.
Now it seems that a hand gun was found in your luggage.
Yes, but… W: According to the statement you made, you had never seen the hand gun before it was found in your bag
Kumar that to bring a hand gun into Hong Kong without proper authorization is a serious offense.

sentences.en: The doctors also wore guns at their waist.
sentences.cn: 医生们的腰间也带着手枪。

sentences.en: The guns destroyed the enemy's position.
sentences.cn: 大炮摧毁了敌人的阵地。

sentences.en: The criminal gunned the policeman down and escaped.
sentences.cn: 罪犯将警察击伤, 逃走了。

sentences.en: The motorcycle gunned through the streets.
sentences.cn: 摩托车加大油门穿过街道。

sentences.en: The pilot of the airplane gunned his engine for a sharp climb.
sentences.cn: 飞行员加大油门使飞机急剧爬升。

jushi.english: He shot a wolf with his gun.
He is the criminal who used a gun to rob people.
jushi.chinese: 他就是那个持枪抢劫的罪犯。
